title: Bayern Munich chief Uli Hoeness rules out Niklas Sule for rest of the season and Euro 2020
text:
Bayern Munich defender Niklas Sule will miss the rest of the season and this summer's European Championships, according to Uli Hoeness.

The Germany international tore the cruciate ligament in his left knee during Bayern's 2-2 draw with Augsburg on Saturday.

Sule underwent surgery on the problem over the weekend and is expected to be out for several months.

Bayern Munich president Uli Hoeness says Niklas Sule can 'forget' playing at #EURO2020 after tearing his ACL on Saturday 😔



Here's how he did it 🤕 pic.twitter.com/kAfyeaNWou — Goal (@goal) October 21, 2019

Bayern ace Niklas Sule damaged his cruciate ligament during their draw against Augsburg

'He can forget the Euros. The season is over for him.' Bayern chief Hoeness confirmed this week.



Despite Sule's injury, Hoeness has insisted that Bayern will not dip into the January market to buy a replacement for him.

Instead, Bayern will ask summer signings Lucas Hernandez and Benjamin Pavard to play centrally for the duration of the season.

Bayern travel to Greece to play Olympiakos for their Champions League encounter next week before returning to league action at home against Union Berlin on October 26.
description: The Germany international tore the cruciate ligament in his left knee during Bayern's 2-2 draw with Augsburg on Saturday and  has been ruled out for the rest of the season.
